Reviews.Title: “Rubbish service..dreadful.”
Reviews.Author: Christophertkf
Reviews.Content: Never again..when we first got there,the outside was old,dirty,smelled of sewage everywhere.Thought It might be fine inside,but it was even worst.Service was terrible,the hair drier didnt work in the room,ask the people that worked there they said I can't help u,it's too late,and it was about 5o clock..asked the next morning,another staff said she doesn't know what I mean this that and the other..breakfast was rubbish..everything was serve on plastic plates and cups..location wise was not bad too be fair..about 15mins walk to colosuem..

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Superb Location But Currently Bing Refurbished”
Reviews.Author: RObbo60_11
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in mid Feb 2012 as we were in Rome for 4 nights primarily to watch Italy V England in the Rugby 6 Nations. The hotel is being refurbished and therefore the reception and breakfast dining has had to be moved to a much smaller annex so room was a bit tight for breakfast. Continental style breakfast but a reasonable choice and excellent value for money. The staff were superb, especially the catering staff supplying breakfast. Reception staff was really good and their spoken english was excellent which is very helpful to ignorant people like me who won't learn other languages. We payed £29 per person per night including tourist tax and breakfast for a hotel very close to the Colosseum, clean rooms with ensuite bathroom but a tad on the small side is all. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel, whether the price will increase when the refurb is completed I can't comment on. We flew with Lufthansa with a short stopover in Frankfurt, flying from Heathrow - they were excellent, good legroom (I am 6 foot 2 inches tall) and plenty of seat width and the seat belt still had a good 8 inches "spare" with my 44 inch waist, superb. The hotel also arranged for a taxi to pick us up from the Airport (Flumincio) which was 50 euros but was a 9 seater taxi so we thought it was good value, the journey is about 40 minutes and is a pain by train or bus/coach as we have done that before. The taxi was there waiting where the hotel said it would be, excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Detracted from Rome !”
Reviews.Author: 23Barry23
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights from 19.01.2012. The hotel was being refurbished (there was no mention of this when booking), this meant that on arrival into our room we were greeted by the souind of a pnuematic drill (oh joy !!). We requested to move rooms and were placed across the street, this room was very poorly furnished compared to the first room offered. the walls were dirty and the double bed was 2 singles pushed together, the third bed for the kid was about 2 feet from the 2 pushed together beds. In other words the room was very small. The breakfast was ok but that should be expected from a supposed 3 star hotel, but it was nothing to write home about. There are many hotels in the same area and i am sure they must be better than this place, my advice would be avoid this place as it just detracted from the joy of visiting Rome. Shop around there are definitely better hotels in very similar location........Dont be tempted you'll just be left feeling ripped off..... The only plus was the staff, though i dont include the female owner in this, smiling may help !!!

Reviews.Title: “***Disappointed***”
Reviews.Author: MJMSxr
Reviews.Content: I went with my wife just this past week and needless to stay we will not be returning. Unfortunately, this hotel probably has tons of potential, but lacks what it takes to bring back customers. The 2 positives that I will note are the location and a few extremely friendly and accommodating employees. At first site, the room was obviously smaller than anything we had ever been in, but we were willing to look past that. However, the floor was very dirty, the comforter had stains on it, and the bathroom smelled very bad. Overall, the room was extremely small, not very clean, and in turn not very comfortable. Those were the main things. A bunch of little things like the hair dryer only worked for a minute or so at a time. The breakfast wasn't amazing, but not terrible. Friendly staff and some pretty basic food items. Do not attempt to be amazed by the breakfast. Below I rated the Service as "Poor", this was due to an unfriendly and condescending front desk person. Would not recommend for couples or families.

Reviews.Title: “3 stars but with the value of 1 and 1/2 not more”
Reviews.Author: Silvia1969
Reviews.Content: A part from the wonderful location we could not understand how this hotel got 3 stars: the rooms are very small, they would have nice terraces but they are very dirty, the staff is helpful if you ask but it's hard to see them smiling. The breakfast is bad: apparently there is plenty of food but all of very poor quality (a part from the good croissants): juice, cold cuts, cheese, yogurt all coming from a discount and of just 1 type. Even the espresso and capuccino were poor. We choosed it because another hotel where we usually stay in Rome was full but we won't come again

Reviews.Title: “Dirty”
Reviews.Author: CeciliaAlves
Reviews.Content: Good location, but... 1 dirty room - the bathroom had a bad smell 2. the elevator only fits 2 persons. then you take long time to go up or down 3. there were pigeons on the roof making noise

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, So-So Service, Poor Breakfast, Not Soundproof”
Reviews.Author: jmsgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our Honeymoon in Rome. It was great for a budget or even a hostel, but not as a hotel...We stayed in a hostel in Nice, France better than this. The staff was kind, knowledgeable about where we were located on a map, but they were just average. They put us in the only room on the first floor next to the reception area. We heard constant traffic from check in/out, etc. Our room was pretty cramped and the TV was a little, tiny thing that would only pick up the local channels (and did so with LOTS of static), which was rather disappointing. The breakfast was the most disappointing on all of our travels in Europe.... BUT a big plus was that the air conditioning worked!! There are a handful of stores near buy but they are pretty expensive. It is only a short walk to an air-conditioned Internet spot from the hotel though. The only real good thing about this hotel was that it was just down the street from an AWESOME pizza parlor! It is approximately at 83 Via Serpenti (walk away from the Colosseum) and has a green sign that sticks out over the sidewalk infront of the pizza parlor. They give you a HUGE piece of pizza with a coke for 5 euro! You can't beat that! Plus the pizza is incredible! I've had much Italian pizza, and it always seems disappointing, but this place tasted so delicious. We literally ate there every meal!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: jumpingthroughhoops
Reviews.Content: Our room (100 euro per night) was tiny smallest room I have ever been in other than as a student. The bathroom smelt of poo (plumbing I think). Breakfast was a selection of stale pastries and orange squash worst breakfast I have ever had in any hotel in europe. The staff really can't be bothered to help and seemt o be on the internet all day. The location is great if you can put up with the rest

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BurefieldDick
Reviews.Content: When first checking in we were placed in the annexe across the road. Not only up many stairs but paper thin walls. After the first night we were relocated to the main building which has a lift and solid walls. Much better. Our room was fine, clean and comfortable with a balcony (not much of a view). The bathroom was reasonable size but had a permanent odour. Breakfast was a good range of continental offerings served in a pleasant room. Other comments have remarked about reception. Our experience was mixed with some staff being extremely helpful and pleasant but one individual surly and unhelpful. The best thing about the hotel is the location. Great for getting to all the sites either on foot or by public transport (very easy to use). Also plenty of good trattorias nearby for evening dining. Just a quick word about Rome. great city but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: ian1000
Reviews.Content: Arrived to the staff welcoming, informative, friendly and helpful. Our Italian was none existentt, but the couldn't be more helpful. We expected a small room based on comments of typical Roman B&B's, but were surprised to find that the room had sufficient space for a large bed, storage, fridge and TV. Bathroom was compact, but large enough for our needs. The shower had plenty of space and hot water and plenty of clean towels. We were surprised by breakfast as we expected coffee and a small cake. However, we had pastries, cornflakes, yoghurt, cake, french toast, bread rolls and cheese. With juice and coffee. Location, step outside and you can see the collisseum, which was ten minutes walk away and a further five to the forum. Plenty of restaurants nearby( we can reccomend the Grillo Brillo!). Overall a lovely stay, wouldn't hesitate to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure...”
Reviews.Author: Bonovox88
Reviews.Content: The room was ok, breakfast buffet not many things to choose and totally overpriced! The only thing that was really good was the location! Nice bar and small shops just around the corner! If you spend time in the room not recommended! Otherwise is just ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: JaneFeGs
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near to Colesseo and the view on the street was perfect. We stayed for 9nights and we enjoyed the hotel because we are in the middle of everything and we sleep well that it was quiet at nights. You can go everywhere from Via buy bus or by walk. But the walls are thin, no fan in bathroom (they put an airfreshener), lots of receptionists who are working different days (3-4 are welcoming). Breakfast was well and you can access internet on the entrance hall.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel with sight on colloseum”
Reviews.Author: jacobine31
Reviews.Content: A very nice small hotel with helpfull receptionists. we stayed in a room-3 pers wich was very small but you only sleep there. Mmaybe that other rooms are bigger and with view, we had a little window that looked out on a little patio that was used as a store-room. The bathroom was also very small. Our room was halfway below the celler, next to the breakfest room, wich was also small en some times you have to wait for a table. The braekfest was ok, but come early then everything (bread ed) is enough there Is almost in the middle of old Rome en there are enough nice restaurant near and that is what make this hotel good. One could use a computer by the reception for free

Reviews.Title: “good location, ideal for family groups”
Reviews.Author: Carmen71
Reviews.Content: I travelled with husband and 3 children. Room was on 1st floor overlooking street. Has double glazing and airconditioning so noise was not an issue. We were given a room with a double bed and three singles. It was comfortable. Bus stop across the street and very near to metro station and San Pietro in Vincole Church. Good Gelateria across the street and a Salumeria with an excellent choice of cheeses and italian meats just a few doors down the road - which also sells fresh bread daily. Breakfast was OK if you like sweet things. On arrival the receptionist took time to give us info about hotel surroundings and how best to reach the attractions as well as information about buses and restaurant and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “basic stuff with great location”
Reviews.Author: harrivassu
Reviews.Content: I spotted this hotel as "last minute choice" with tripple room in August. We arrived late in the evening having first been ripped off by a taxidriver from Termini to Hotel Anfiteatro. How ever the reception was very nice and we went to our room. The room was very small even by normal standards in Rome- yet very clean. The bathroom and windows were newly renovated. Still the hand set of the shower was broken and taking a shower was a real trick. Due to new windows there was absolutely no street noise in the room. The room also had an air conditioning that was very nice considering the daytime temperature was some 29° during our stay. The breakfast was continental with white bread and jelly, so very basic. The coffee is italian style and yes, the old lady is still making it. To us she was pretty nice. So, if you are travellling with tight budget this hotel is a good choice. We stayed in the room called "Severo". There are no room numbers. Every room has a name. Had the room been more spacious (and the TV working. It had only green picture:), we would have given more points considering the pricetag. Actually -to my opinion- you have to cut off one star when you rate hotels in Rome. I wonder who rates them anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: d_goes
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, interested staff with good tips for a trip in the city of Rome and dinerspots. Good value for money. excellent location near the coloseum and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HK355
Reviews.Content: As we approached the hotel we were greeted with a view of the Coliseum a couple blocks down the street. The central location of this hotel is it's best feature. Walking distance to the forum, fontana di trevi, central termini and shopping. We were greeted with an enthusiastic welcome from the receptionist and an informative introduction to the area. And those we the highlights. The staff at times were friendly and at other times close to miserable. The hotel is essentially a 5 storey walkup. There is a minuscule lift which can hold two people or one person and your suitcases. We found it faster to walk up than wait for the lift most times. The rooms are exceptionally basic. Ours had one double and one single bed. There are a couple small closets and a 14" TV - although we couldn't get any reception. The bathroom again was functional and basic although it did have a bidet. The shower hose had been taped and tied to repair leaks and wasn't quite long enough to fit in the holder mounted on the wall. The room wasn't particularly clean but it wasn't filthy either. There was a small balcony facing the rear of the building. Breakfast was served in the basement. It was a fairly poor selection of cereal, pastries and yoghurt. Fresh coffee was available. Wifi was available in the reception area for 3 euros a day. 15 minutes complimentary use of the computer per day was available.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly room (named Theodosio)”
Reviews.Author: Modaro
Reviews.Content: To ugly room, ugly view, ugly and small bathroom for this money. Definitely not the one from the pictures presented on the hotel website. Breakfast was ok ... also the location. So sad for such a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch swindlers”
Reviews.Author: travelgoat63
Reviews.Content: The management here cares nothing about service. They only want your money and once they get it you are totally on your own. They did not honor the rate quoted on eurocheapo or rates to go and somehow "my reservation did not arrive." They had me alone with two kids in an annex building with a dark entrance and private residences. Their breakfast was in a damp basement and wholly uninteresting. They said I could not share a bed with my 8 year old but had to have three separate beds "Because of the Italian law." The best thing about this hotel is the pizzaria across the street!

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: corcona
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very well situated in the City-Center - you can easily walk to all the sights and even can see the Colosseum from the front door. It´s clean and calm there. The room was small but sufficient with enough furniture to place everything. The breakfast was fine with cereals, bread, cake and marmelade and a really good capuccino. And the stuff was very friendly and helpful. We definitely can recommend this place. You get a good value for the money you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff but very dirty room”
Reviews.Author: AniqueJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my mom last week for 6 nights. The location is wonderfull right in the middle of the city centre. When walking out you can see the Colloseum at the end of the street. The breakfast is nice, the staff friendly. We were assigned a spacious triple room but unfortunately a room with carpet in a hotel where they obviously do not own a vacuum cleaner... The hotel could use a make over. Only small changes would make it absolutely perfect. I guess I would only recommend this hotel if you insist on getting a room with tiles instead of carpet ;o(

Reviews.Title: “Awful, awful place.....spend a bit extra and go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Sunbeam30
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 2 nights in December and it was the worst accomodation I've ever stayed in. Seriously, its that bad. If we had been staying in Rome for 3 nights, I would have immediately moved to alternative accomodation, but as our stay was so short, we decided to endure it. The first room we were in was in the block across the road and was dirty and the size of a shoebox. The toilet was was in a tiny space/room at one end of the bedroom and then you had to leave there and use the sink in the other space at the opposite end of the room. Even the walls were filthy. We then moved to a slightly less disgusting room, also in the block across the road, but by this time I just wanted to start exploring and not let the place spoil our experience in Rome. The location is the only thing this hotel has in its favour, but even then there are other hotels nearby that could only be better.

Reviews.Title: “Be carefull... Don´t go there! Horrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaAlmeida
Reviews.Content: I booked a double room two months before my arrival. They always answered to my emails giving me informations that i asked for, everything was ok until i got there! I booked my room seeing previously the photos in a website and i wrote an email to the hotel asking if that photos were the same photos of their rooms they said yes!! I also booked a room with PRIVATE BATHROOM!!!!! When I arrived the lady in the reception gave me my keys and the room didnt have private bathroom. The bathroom was OUTSIDE the room in front of other rooms!!!! The room was absolutely SMALL!!!!!!!!!!! I couldnt pass between the bed and the wall, there wasn´t space. I talked to the lady and she moved us to another room in the day after! But, we had to pay the same price for that HORRIBLE night! The breakfast wasnt good either! They only had milk, coffe, juice, croissant and butter! Nothing else. No ham, no cheese.... Well there are so many hotels in rome, please search a little more and make your reservation in another place!!!

Reviews.Title: “good position - only for night stay”
Reviews.Author: chemboy81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is positioned at the historic city centre, a perfect position for the price paid (60euros per night for a double room). At our arrival the receptionist could't find our reservation (which was found the day after). we were given a room at the basement, wih no windows but an upper opening electrically driven. Huge spots of mould on the ceiling and in the bathroom. Our room was next to the breakfast room and since 7am we got awaken by the people having breakfast. Despite these experiences, the personnel is really friendly and helpful in giving direction/information, the breakfast is not so rich but pretty good. Perfect site to stay only for the night. Sure not for any kind of amusements (no bar, nor gym or any kind of leisure).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: BetaBreak
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, there is everything you need nearby, and even though it's in the middle of Rome, it still feels like it's a break from the big city due to the location - a rather small street with moderate/low traffic. This hotel is very small, so a "Suite" is recommended - and affordable. There's also A/C which comes in handy in those hot days ;) Located close to Colosseum, and the main shopping-street Via Del Corso =D. We also walked as much as possible, so everything should be in walking distance, and if not.. use a cab ;)

Reviews.Title: “The Older Lady is still serving breakfast there”
Reviews.Author: edkuchi
Reviews.Content: I read in Tripadvisor about an rude older lady serving breakfast there before I booked the hotel. Yes, she is still there and she is still very very rude. We decided to have our breakfast in another room just to avoid seeing her. The breakfast was reasonable. Look for ants in the sugar bottle, they work hard. The location of the hotel is great, You can see the Coliseum right from the front of the hotel. Two Metro stations only a block or so away. A bus stop right in front that will take you to the Piazza Navona area where you cannot reach by Metro. There are so many restaurants closed by that you will sure find one that fit your budget and taste. There is also a travel agent next door that can help you to book train tickets. Couple grocery stores for fresh fruits, wines, cheese, deli meat and dried fungi porcini (for souvenir). The front desk service was great. They helped us to book the museum tickets. But please double check the information they provide you, because some of them can give you unnecessary problem, especially if they are not familiar with it and have to look it up for you. It is hard to find a quad room (sleep 4) in Rome, they have one but is across the street from the hotel. It is on the 3rd floor with no lift, so it will be challenging to carry your luggage up the steep stairs. The air conditioning was not functioning properly 4 of the 5 days we were there, at 40 degree C, it is somewhat uncomfortable. They did fix it the night before we left. The room is clean, so is the bathroom. Once a while, we had to go across the street to get more towels. One thing you have to do is to make sure you throw your soiled towels further away from the rack or check to make sure they do not put it back for you.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with allright standard and service in a very good location, close to the attractions and in a decent and calm n”
Reviews.Author: mrgoodtrips
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights from the 15th to the 17th of September 2009. We stayed in the double room 'Tacito' on the ground floor. We payed 160€, with 10% in advance. Location: The location is great, just some hundred meters from the Colosseo. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant (they serve only breakfast), but there are many restaurants close to the hotel. The street the hotel is in is pretty quiet, especially for Rome, and the area felt safe. Room: The room had a decent size, with a real double bed, not just two singles. The room had a window out to a very small kind of terrace/courtyard, from where other reviewers have reported noise and lack of privacy. We did not experience this problem, and was not troubled by noise. It isn't really a terrace to sit in, but just a small open space to let light in. There are also some shutters on the window, so privacy shouldn't really be a problem. There is AC in the room as well, wich worked properly and without too much noise. There are several closets where you can hang your clothes. The bathroom was OK but not perfect. The shower was not very new, and seemed like it was installed by an amateur (much silicone around the fixtures). Not too big either, but it worked. Breakfast: The breakfast was served from 7.30 to 9.30 I think. The breakfast was good, with rolls, cheese, ham, salami, yam, yoghurt, cereals, juice and a small coffee-bar. The selection of croissants and cakes was enormous. The service was impeccable. Internet: The hotel did not have wireless internet, but had a computer in the breakfast area with internet connection. Fifteen minutes a day for each room was free, and you had to pay for access exceeding that. I think they wanted 2€ for half an hour or something. Service: The reception was staffed 24 hours a day, and the service was good, and the reception staff spoke well English. Check-out time was 10.00. We had a nice stay and could recommend this hotel to other travellers. We didn't check very much around, so I can't say how the price is for a hotel in Rome, but I think it has an OK price.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: Jacarandar
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is very cheap and in a central location, if this is all you can afford then stay home until you have saved more money.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FonzieHaarlem
Reviews.Content: Behind the busy street Via Nazionale we have found a great (not to big) bed and breakfast hotel. The employés were very kind and the breakfast was very good.. The room we had was cleaned every day. And with the heat of the summer, the aircondtioning did his work good. At the reception there were great people helping us with our questions. One special lady of Iraq (unfortunaly I've lost her name) at the reception helped us very well and speaks many languages. So when she is at work, communicating is no problem. We curtainly wil recommand our family and friends this hotel when they have the idea to go to Rome. Thnak you all for a great time at Rome and stay in your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 is the perfect rating!!”
Reviews.Author: canuckpump
Reviews.Content: As other guests have said, this is a great hotel in a great location if you are on a tight budget and you can get a good deal. That being said, the rooms are a bit smelly and dated, the breakfast choices and hours( 7:30 - 9:30) are very poor, and the lobby is tiny. BUT: The staff at the desk were wonderful, helpful and pleasant, with the exception of the night shift guy who was asleep alot of the time. We had a quad room which was plenty big enough with the exception of a very cramped bathroom. AC worked good, that means the world to me. Tiny elavator, one bag at a time!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean Basic in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: padocon
Reviews.Content: Every room is equipped with: Private bath, Direct telephone, Color TV, A/C and Central Heating, Fridge, Hairdryer, Safe Box This is all true. Great value for money. Air condo gave me a cold as I could not regulate it. Very near Metro Cavour & Colleso. You can see the coliseum from the hotel! Fantastic location! Very active nightlife for young people around the fountain near by. The fountain area is a little rough at night, but don't be put off, also policed very well! No wi-fi but 15min free i-net on shared computer.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Sparky4744
Reviews.Content: Good location, very near Cavour Metro and you could easily walk around to all major sites with the aid of map given, apart from Vatican which is a bit further over the river. Breakfast was typical continental I suppose, quite sweet and not what you'd be use to in the UK, the selection wasn't that good either, cornflakes? looked like and sweet bread, croissants and cakes and yoghurts.Lady in the dining area didn't seem that friendly either, stern and didn't seem to like the British, that's the impression we got anyway, breakfast dishes we noticed were dirty on the last morning there. In contrast to this, there was a lovely girl on reception when we arrived and on duty in the daytime, very friendly and helpful, spoke good English, pleasure to speak to. Hotel room was small, but servicable as a base, bathroom very small, all Italian tv, but watched some of it and tried to make sense of it and thought it was funny, got by and made the most of it. There is a sewrage smell in bathroom at times, but then again it was peak summertime and the street drains smell the same. Overall would probably recommend for the money as long as your aware of what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Eric_188
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel, basic rooms in very good location, in a walking distance from Cavour metro station. Quite neighborhood with variety of restaurants, great ice screams just opposite the hotel. Like: location & neighborhood Dislike: simple and basic rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: hamletfan8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just a few blocks from the Colosseum which was fantastic. The staff was incredibly friendly, helpful and very knowledgeable about the area. The rooms where clean and the amenities were adequate. However, the room was small and the price was a little expensive considering the size of the room. But in the end, it was worth it to have the great location.

Reviews.Title: “Go to this hotel, great location, ideal for visit Rome”
Reviews.Author: mihail61
Reviews.Content: I was with my family 5 night in this hotel, in a triple room, 2nd floor. The staff are frendly and the breakfast was more than our expectation (salami, mortadela, butter, chees, fresh orange 1l on the table, more than 3 kind of cakes, milk, and coffe - american, espresso, capucino, toasts, honney,...). From the hotel it possible to book a cab, or a minivan to and from the airport (50euro for 4 in a cab and 60 euro for 5 and more for a minivan). In the hotel area are: 4 minimarkets, an very good icecream location, a pizza al forno with more than 20 combinations of topings, many italian restaurants , some of the bests are: La tavernalle, La Carbonarra - both on a Via Panisperna and a Il Tettarello located on Via dei Capocci where we was eating 2 times. So, the hotel is very good for visit Rome, after a walking day and a good food, you will sleep very good and do you not observ al the negative issues. Do'ot forget to taste Limoncello.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff!!”
Reviews.Author: _blondiine_
Reviews.Content: We were 4 girls! travel for budget holidays. The hotel was in great location, apr.5 min walking distance to Coloseum. We stayed in apartment on other side of street. The room was on the 2nd floor. It was clean and nice. Window was on street side. We felt like we were living in real Italian house, cos it was quite small. Next to our hotel there were delitious Ice Cream cafe. Breakfast was very good, but waitress was disappointed that we didn't try to speak with her in italian, but spoke in english. Hotel administrators were very nice and friendly! Good knowledge of Rome, show us on the map, all the best and top places in Rome!! Recomend this for budget travelers and those who don't need very big rooms!

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 3 stars hotel - Don't recommend it!!!”
Reviews.Author: frenchyfaith
Reviews.Content: First night, we were given a room that had the sign PRIVATE on it & was located just in corridor next to the breaksfast area... it was underground as well and really near the reception area... result : hardly any sleep since we could hear everyone come back at all hours & woke up really early from hearing people having their breakfast. Had that for 2 nights... got sick of it & asked for another room. Got given a room upstairs with a FOUL SEWAGE SMELLY bathroom... could not go in it so we asked at the reception and all they could do was give us a industrial strenght deodorizing spray (that apparently shouldn't have been used by untrained people). In both room, the bed was NOT a double bed but two single beds put together... very uncomfortable & unpractical since they kept moving apart. There was too much noise , even in second bedroom(could hear all the other rooms flushing their toilets & people next door acting strange). Only good point was location... but there were loads of other better looking hotels around.. so look for something else. I DONT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL AT ALL... VERY BAD VALUE FOR MONEY

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Maitlandkelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 children in a quadruple room. The location was great, we could walk everywhere,but the hotel itself- I would not recommend to anyone who needs to walk when in a room! We were in a room across the road from the main hotel with our 2 children, no lifts, it was a massive effort to get our bags up all the stairs! No space to store luggage, we put some things under the bed, the rest we had to step over or leave on the bed. Speaking of which, they were so hard I had sore shoulders when sleeping on my side! The rest of the familycould not sleep at all they were so hard! Dust under the beds, a less than enthusiastic waitress at breakfast and a room that was so small we could barely move leaves me to say that other than a great location this place has no positives about it at all!

Reviews.Title: “Below expectation...”
Reviews.Author: shtan
Reviews.Content: Rome is our last destination in Italy and we stayed in this hotel for 2 nights. Overall experience is not good. Cons - A hassle to get to our room. We had been allocated a room in the building across the street. 3 keys were required to get to our room. 1st key - to get inside the building. 2nd key - to enter the apartment that had 3 hotel rooms, after climbing 2 flights of stairs and carrying with us heavy luggages. 3rd key - hotel room key. The building houses other permanent stayers aside from the hotel guests. Room is cramp and the furnitures looked old. Toilet room is separated from the bathing and sink room. Thus not so convenient. Heater is terribly noisy, especially when other occupancies turn on their water tap. Its so unbearable that we tend to wake very early. Towels were not changed during our 2 nights stay. Pros - Nice breakfast, good service from hotel staff. Near to Cavour train station, near to Colossuem.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint with a good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: boleric
Reviews.Content: We rented a room for 5 people at this hotel and it was large and very clean. The room had a bedroom and another room with a fridge and two more beds in it. The bathroom was small but had a shower and toilet and a non working bidet. The room had an air conditioner that worked well. Staff was friendly and courteous and was able to handle our special requests (early check out, directions, bag storage). Location of hotel was great. Short walk to the Colleseum and close to a major road with main bus routes. Breakfast was tasty and consisted mostly of pastries, yougurt and coffee. All in all a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Where Emperors stay...”
Reviews.Author: masden
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Hotel Anfiteatro Flavio in Rome. The hotel is very central, at walking distance from Stazione Termini and from Via Nazzionale (famous for shopping) and Via Cavour. Very close to the Colosseum, which is lovely - beware of the gladiators because they will rip off your money for taking pics with you!! It happened to us, but we soon learnt the lesson and we only took pics with the first pair of gladiators, the rest we left them begging to show us their forces!! And soon we showed them that we were not interested!! The room at the hotel, even though a bit small, was comfortable and clean, good for us for a short stay. The only thing that I hated was the elevator which is very small and that the towels are changed every 2 days. However, the room is cleaned daily. Breakfast was very good, having rolls, cold cuts, cereals, yoghurts, cakes, coffee, tea, orange juice, etc. Staff at the breakfast area always served us with a smile and staff at the reception desk were very welcoming and helpful. Eating out is not a problem, since the hotel is surrounded with very good restaurants. Just down the road, on the way to the Colosseum, there is a corner restaurant named 'Wanted' which serves lovely food. And opposite the hotel there is a Gelateria which has delicioussssssss ice-creams with many flavours, try it, you will not regret it believe me! And for all those who love pasta, a good restaurant very close to Fontana Di Trevi, named L'Allegro Pachino at Via dei Crocifieri, 12/13, serves very tasty dishes! Overall I must say that I definately recommend this hotel, and quite sure that we may be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Not everything it as seems”
Reviews.Author: oracleEngland
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not three star, more like a basic two star. Not too sure when it was refurbished but would suggest that it was several years ago. If you use the photos on the web site to try and locate the hotel you will struggle to find it as the main picture does not show the hotel but a small fountain about 5 mins walk away. The picture of the room is also a little misleading, they are tiny. The room we stayed in had a very strong smell of poor drains and despite telling the desk staff nothing happended so you had to leave the windows open at all times - if you read some of the historical reviews they had the same problem (hindsight is wonderful) Desk staff were freindly but staff in basement breakfast area were surly and unhelpful and if you dont get there early there will be nothing for you, quite a poor selection and if you arrive near fininshing time they are quite rude and will start to put food away before making your selection. Location is good but when arriving from the train station be careful with taxi's as they will take you around in a circle and charge you about 35 euro when in fact the fare is about 12 euroi - quite difficult to find you are better using the metro if you can as it is only about 5 mins walk away. Would not stay here again as there are much better hotels only saving grace is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SurCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days here in August. We had a triple which was in the building just across from the main hotel building. The staff was very friendly, helpful and spoke good English. The location is great, within walking distance of ancient Rome and the Colosseum. The bathroom was modern, the air conditioning. Great pizza in restaurants down the road. We had a very early flight out and didn't have an alarm and the guy (Mattieu) at the front desk, woke us and arranged the taxi - personal service. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “horible experience”
Reviews.Author: hidybear
Reviews.Content: **READ THIS STORY IF YOU ARE PLANNING ON STAYING AT THIS HOTEL** i was 17 years old in august 08 and had planned a nice weekend break with my girlfriend who was also 17. the hotel is well situated near the colosseum so immediately i was excited upon arrival. when we arrived we were told that our room was not ready but we left the luggage in the reception and went out to enjoy the sites. in august, rome was particularly hot and after 4 or so hours we retuned to our hotel to freshen up a bit. upon arriving we were told that our plumbing was broken and apparently this was all explained to us earlier that day (it wasnt atall). we were then told that we would be changed to a different hotel just for the one night and could come back in the morning. not a huge deal really but time was taken out of our rome experience which wasn't a cheap weekend anyway and wasting time wasnt exactly going to go down well with either of us. after an hour of sitting in the reception, a large man burst through the doors and took me and my girlfriend away in his car. we were not told who this man was and he asked our ages in a very forward manner as soon as we got into his car. he then began speeding into narrow roads not giving any indication where we were or how much fiurther it was. after 15 minutes of driving he pulled up outside a building, bundled me and my girlfriend into an incredibley old elevator and held up 4 fingers indicating it was four floor. this was all a bit scary for both of us as upon entering the building, it was clear that this was a significant downgrade of a hotel as it was miles from anywhere and homeless people were sleeping outside in the entrance. usually when you are inconvienienced by a hotel (which does inevitabley happen) they make an effort to help the situation and if they cannot get a hotel of a similar standard, the will upgrade you. this hotel however was a significantly worse. this hotel was called hotel morpheus incase you are wondering. upon enterng the room provided, i couldnt help but look at the stain covered seats and the floor which hadnt been cleaned for a number of weeks. the bed had hairs all in it and the bathroom was beyond belief. i was really not happy about this as the original hotel was cearly trying to save money by forcing us kids into a downgraded cheap hotel that wasnt suitable for anyone with any degree of standards. upon asking the woman at the recpetion about the cleanliness of the hotel she argued that the hotel was fine and that i was wrong. she argued to the bitter end that i was lying and that the room was perfectly clean but trust me on this guys, it was disgusting. she even came in and when i pointed at the dirt, she said there was nothing there. i then took my bags and me and my girlfriend left in a taxi an returned to the original hotel Flavio. here i was greeted by the staff and asked what the matter was. they too told me i was wrong and that i should reconsider. this matter had now wasted 2 and a half hours of my holiday and was now getting late. the woman at reception said that she would ring another hotel and that we would be accomodated just around the corner for the night and that she would take us to see it. i agreed reluctantly and left the building with her and my grlfriend. about 2 mins walk down the road the woman began shouting a name. eventually a woman came out from a resturant wearing a cleaners outfit. the woman from my original hotel had brought me out to talk to the cleaner of the second hotel about the standard of hygene in that hotel. i was by this point fuming. i said that they are deliberately wasting my time, that i would not possibley stay in the second hotel and that i would return in three hours an expected either the plumbing to be fixed or another better hotel to be arranged. as i left the recptionist was shouting about how i was just a kid and that if i was going to do travelling then i should be prepared to be treated like this. after three hours i returned to find that the room planned for my stay had been fixed by a plumber and i could stay in it. why wasnt this done before? perhaps they overbooked and thought that us kids would be easy to pesuade to stay somewhere else, perhaps they just treat their customers this poorley in general. whatever the case, do not stay at this hotel as here are many better ones available that wouldnt treat customers in this fashion

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Place!”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Gannon
Reviews.Content: As previous reviews this hotel is v close to the coliseum and Metro/bus stops. Our (double) room was on the ground floor opposite the steps into the breakfast room, facing into a small courtyard. The room had TV, hairdryer and best of all Air Con (at no extra cost) – it was great to come back out of the heat and cool down. The bathroom had a good shower with lots of hot water. The room also had a dressing area with wardrobe - so plenty of storage for cases/clothes etc. The breakfast was simple but plenty, yoghurt, cereals, pastries etc and the staff are excellent – all very helpful esp the chap on reception who gave us all the info we needed to get around and see the sights. I booked via LastMinute.com and the hotel e-mailed me to confirm - very efficient!.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nell2
Reviews.Content: The Anfiteatro Flavio is a good hotel in an excellent location. It is situated very close to the Colosseum and other historic sites. All of the staff was very friendly and most helpful. They also spoke good English. Our room was quite spacious, basic and clean. The breakfast was a buffet, although choice was limited. The price includes 15 minutes of free internet use a day per room, which is useful to e.g. check-in online for the departing flight.

Reviews.Title: “Noooooo!”
Reviews.Author: Bertie75
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the high number of positive reviews on this site. I guessed i'd try it based on my budget and giving the benefit of the doubt to the hotel. Mistake. Unlike other reviews the hotel isn't a '10 min walk' from the Termini Station, it's closer to 20 minutes. The location definitely is it's strong point though, being a few minutes walk from the Metro and a 5-10 minute stroll to the Colloseum. Despite this and the fact that the Receptionist was very helpful & friendly, my girlfriend and i moved out after just one night. The room we were given was on the top (5th) floor and was the 'Poppea' room adjacent to the 'Cleopatra' room. The Poppea bedroom is so small it doesn't have a bathroom within it, you have to go across a landing to your own separate facilitiies. A bit strange but nothing too bad. But the fact that the walls were so thin you could virtually hear everything from seemingly the floor below, not just next door, was what initiated my desire to move. I failed to get to sleep until approx 1:30am due to other guests noise. The main reason though for moving out was the ANTS. Yep, i noticed about three ants on the bedroom floor before going to bed but thought nothing of it. In the morning i awoke to what can be best described as scene from a wildlife documentary. This may sound like i'm trying to create dramatic effect here but i am totally honest when i say they were streaming along the floor by the wall from the door to window. They'd managed to form some sort of mini colony around our belongings on the floor. Luckily only the odd one had gotten into the bag or clothings. But as you lifted things off the floor you were left with a black outline of the item on the floor made up of small ants. I followed the 'trail' and it seemed to end in our room but originate from the 'Cleopatra' room next to us as they filed under the bedroom doors. I obviously can't claim to judge the rest of the hotel's rooms (or the breakfast area for that matter!) but i felt it only fair to warn people of what they may be sharing their room with on the top floor. It's unfortunate that i write this review as the receptionist (manageress?) was most apologetic and understanding stating the rooms were cleaned just the previous day and claimed not to have had this complaint before. I just couldn't stay another night there though. Not a good start to my first time in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in excellent central location”
Reviews.Author: streeters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and found hotel to be clean and friendly in an excellent location. Our room was on second floor facing inner courtyard area and so very quiet at night. Good size double bed, tv, wardrobe and a secure safe in room. Bathroom is small but shower was excellent with plenty of hot water. Breakfast was simple continental style buffet with cereal, pastries, rolls, yoghurt etc plus coffee/tea and juice. There is also small lift to all floors if needed. Hotel is only 5 mins walk from Colisseum, 15 mins from Trevi fountain, 20 from Pantheon and 35 mins from Vatican . Terminus train station is 15 min walk away. Thoroughly recommend if you want a reasonably priced budget hotel in a very central location within walking distance of all main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinozayed
Reviews.Content: hi i had quite a nice experience staying in this small hotel located very close to the colloseum...in fact the hotel location was the best thing..its got a nice ice cream shop opposite it and coffee shop..shoe shops, pharmacy , 2 indian restaurants are also very pleasing to see there ...very lively street...my trip to rome was very interesting indeed the hotel room itself was reasonable , nothing great,its got a wooden roof and the double bed like everyone had said is actually 2 beds joined together..airconditioning is powerful ..one main problem was the bathroom,there was a sharp pungent smell coming from the toilet and the actual shower room was quite small..hairdryer power is not so much also small soaps were provided.The cleaner didnt actually throw away our used cups so that was a bit annoying..we actually paid 400 euros for three nights which is a lot for this hotel but this was through another site so best book directly with hotel for a good rate like 80 euro per night..another problem was the steep steps..the actual hotel room was in another part of building so be careful of these...staff was nice especially the men on reception but one `receptionist was a bit rude by saying she wouldnt make milk for our daughter whilst the other staff were very helpful...its a v ery busy hotel by the way and sumtimes u could hear the other families next door.... like i stated earlier on the hotel is just 10 mins away frm colloseum so bear that in mind and ignore the bad points if u want to save money on travelling daily to centre of rome...

Reviews.Title: “So close to Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: HisnHerrs
Reviews.Content: An Italian friend of ours recommended this B&B to us, so we figured it would be great. It turned out to be OK, nothing spectacular, but not too bad, either. We liked being able to walk to the Colosseum and Roman ruins, as well as the metro stations. The B&B was also right across from a couple of gelaterias and near other restaurants that weren't too pricey. Like another TripAdvisor reviewer, we also had bathroom issues. Something was leaking (not sure if it was the pipes for the shower or toilet), resulting in puddles by the shower. It didn't get resolved while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good!”
Reviews.Author: JosephMTL
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of it's location and price. It is a 5 minute walk to the Colosseum, it's in a good area and near the subway. If you have reasonable expectations then you shouldn't be disappointed in this hotel. The staff was very friendly, although some of them had the typical Italian attitude where it seems like you're bothering them. The good: Very clean. This is my most important criteria. The only thing I noticed was that the floor was a bit dusty (there are no carpets). The room wasn't large but it was more than adequate for one couple and three pieces of luggage. Security: You have to be buzzed in. Breakfast: Lots of croissants (with or without jam/nutella), cereal, milk, pie, cheese, yogurt and more. The staff asked us what we wanted to drink every day, promptly. I always had a cappuccino. Location: Best price/location ratio I found. Service: We only had one pillow each, which is unfortunate, so we used the extra covers under the pillows to give us some lift. The maid must have noticed this and left 2 extra pillows the next day. The surroundings: A lot of good places around. I loved the Gran Cafe at the brazilian coffee shop across the street. I loved the ice cream at the gelato store across the street. I loved the prosciutto at the calabresi deli across the street. You get the picture. The Bad: Paper thin walls: You can hear everything in the hallway/everyone in the hallway can hear you. If you're planning on sleeping in past 7:30am this may be very bad. I didn't have any problem even though I was on the first floor as I woke up early every day. I didn't hear anything from the other rooms. Double bed was actually two twin beds. This was very annoying and we weren't told that was the case. I actually emailed the hotel in advance to ask if it was a double bed and was told yes. Apparently this is common in Italy (My parents had the same thing happen to them over 30 years ago on their honeymoon!) Temperature: The temperature in the room was fine but the hallway was very cold since there is no actual door to the outside, just a gate. Safety: One night we couldn't get to our room because there was a large (fire?) door blocking our way on the first floor. There was no way to open it as it was electronically locked via the front desk. There didn't seem to be any way to open the door from either side. The man at the front desk seemed surprised that it was closed and locked. If this happened and a fire occurred I don't see anyway to get out of the building. This made me VERY uneasy. Wake up Calls: On our last night I was offered a wakeup call because my plane was scheduled for 8am. I used my own alarm as well and thank god because the wake up call never came. I went downstairs to see if my taxi had arrived and the employee was sleeping on the chairs in the front room. Lesson: Always bring your own alarm! Don't let the negatives fool you, overall I liked the place and I liked the price too. Obviously this isn't a 4 star place but if you know that going in you shouldn't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Roman ruins, but bathroom issues”
Reviews.Author: young_dazza
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights. After reading the reviews I requested a room on a higher level, however that never happened and we were given the "Augustus" room on the first floor. This seems to be the only room available big enough to fit a double, two singles and a cot. The location is great. Its about 5 minutes from the underground and 5 minutes walk to the roman forum and 10 minutes to the colloseum. The hotel is in an area that is very typical of Rome - small streets, tiny sidewalk / footpaths, plenty of cafes and restaurants. The street is well lit and the area seems quite safe. Our room unfortunately had a horrible odour coming from the bathroom. We knew about this from the reviews so we werent too upset. We simply left the windows open as much as possible, kept the bathroom door shut, and held our nose when going to the bathroom. Breakfast was simple but fresh, and the staff generally spoke english. The lift was very small but just big enough to fit our baby stroller / buggy which helped. The smell was certainly offputting however we still had a great time in Rome. I'm undecided as to whether I'd come back to this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAESeattleWashington
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row that we have stayed at this hotel. Each year we take a group of 8th grade students to Rome and this is the best place we have stayed at. The hotel staff is friendly, helpful, and speak English perfectly. The location is excellent and the breakfasts are great. This is a true Roman hotel experience and I highly recommend it to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “It's a decent place to stay, especially for Rome”
Reviews.Author: ematchey
Reviews.Content: After doing alot of research on hotels in Rome, I was really scared. I have never read so many negative reviews for hotels over $140 per night. This hotel had decent reviews and I found that to be in line with what we experienced. So here is my feedback along with some photos: LOCATION: probably the best feature of this hotel. it's just a 5-7 minute walk to the Collesseum. We are in our mid-late 20s and didnt have a problem walking all the locations Rome (with the exception of the Vatican). The train station is another 7-10 walk from the hotel ROOM: Clean overall, especially the shower. however you can tell the maids are not completely thoughrough cleaning the floors in the corners and under beds (see pics). the rooms are small but comfortable. The tv is tiny and doesnt have good reception. There was a mini fridge in the room, which was convenient. HOTEL: doesnt really have a "hotel" feeling. It's more like your Italian aunt's bording house atmosphere. There is a separate entrance to the lobby and to to rooms. THe staircase to the rooms is a little dark and shady looking. BREAKFAST: just your basic, nothing extraordinary by any means. there is juice, coffee, cereal, croissants, maybe pasteries and bananas. SERVICE: pretty friendly, we didnt have any negative experiences. the staff speak english pretty well so its convenient to get info/directions, etc. OVERALL: normally i would say that the price was rip off based on what the hotel had to offer, but it being Rome these kind of prices are to be expected. it was good overall. next time i would try to find a better hotel and try to book way way in advance to have a better selection.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Flavio”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolLaw
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel online for a really reasonable rate and was slightly worried about what to expect! but we shouldn't have been!! Hotel was in a great location just down the road from the Colloseum, Roman Forum and Circo Massimo (you could see the Colloseum from outside the hotel and we had a glimpse from our balcony). If you don't mind walking you can also walk around the city from here (we did!), catching loads of sights such as the Pantheon and all the various Piazzas. Metro station Cavour is close by and we caught this to the Vatican which was lovely - go to the museum if you get chance, you could spend a whole week there!! Highlight was by far the Sistine Chapel.. Hotel was really nice and clean and was being repainted and spruced up even more when we were there, bathroom was lovely and the room had a fridge, hairdryer, tv and free safety deposit box. Breakfast was included in the bargain price and was a lovely way to start the day - coffees, juice, yoghurt, cake and an array of tasty pastries!! On the whole would reccomend the hotel, theres a great bar around the corner (turn right outside the hotel - then second right), it was really busy and served gorgeous free snacks with drinks! We also ate at Est Est Est which isn't far which was great.. BE WARNED!! if you're just grabbing a quick snack for lunch opt to take away!! We were ripped off a few times by being told to sit down and they'd bring it over - the worst being near the Vatican, 2 small pizzas a coffee and wate should have been about 6 euro - we were charged 21!!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location but questionable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Jacketer
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings about this hotel. Reception staff were great, very helpful, gave us a map with places of interest to visit marked on it. Breakfast was good too. Room was OK size, with very little storage, had a little balcony which overlooked the inside of other buildings, which was nice. The walls were paper thin and you could hear everthing from next door, there were three english girls staying in the adjacent room and we could hear every word spoken. But the most disturbing element was that we could hear everything from their toilets. When we came back to the room in the evening the balcony door was always open (assuming left open by the cleaner), which meant the room was freezing and there was no central heating in that part of the hotel. The location of the hotel however was excellent, walking distance for most of the places of interest, and some excellent restaurants nearby. I was dissapointed with the transport from the airport as this was part of my birthday present.....Booked the expensive airport to city limo, was picked up in a people carrier on arrival and collected for departure by minicab-looking estate car whose driver was dangerous and erratic at the best of times....be aware!

Reviews.Title: “If you like your sleep, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: kikis25
Reviews.Content: We arrived here and had to wait almost an hour before our room was ready. When we finally got to our room after climbing three flights of steep stairrs with our luggage, we were given a tiny room with an eary feeling. During our one night stay there we didn't sleep at all. The radiator made noise, when you flushed the toilet it took forever for it to flush and drain so we couldn't use it in the night. We heard other guests who had rooms all around us at all hours of the night - we heard people talking, going to the bathroom showering and having sex. They said they were giving us a double bed but instead we got two single beds pushed together and to top it all off the room was infested with bugs. WE found and killed two while we were there. When we went to complain to the front desk and told them that we wanted to leave they said that either we stayed in that room for our entire stay (four days) or lose our money if we chose to leave. They were not compromising in any matter and didn't care about the conditions of their rooms and how their guests felt. It was worst place and service I have ever received in all my years of travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Don't ever stay at this place. This is a 1-2 star place!!”
Reviews.Author: acvbman
Reviews.Content: This hotel sucked!!! The toilet stinks so bad that you couldn't even sleep at night without making sure the toilet lid is closed. The radiator leaked water on the floor. The stairways are dirty and you can hear people on the other far end of the hallway!! The breakfast sucked serving cold bread only! Please never stay in this place or any other place that says 3 star hotel or bed and breakfast. In Rome, you have to stay in a 4 star hotel to get a clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Robear07
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Hotel Anfiteatro Flavio in September, 2007. We occupied the room on the 4th floor (5th level) called, if I remember correctly, "Teodosio". There is a small elevator cleverly wedged into the center space of the original spiral staircase. It worked just fine for us during our entire stay. Our room had two windows on adjacent walls which opened onto an interior court. This eliminated most street noise and provided for good cross ventilation during mild evenings. During warmer weather, we found the air-conditioner effective and quiet. The room was clean and adequately furnished. It even included a third single bed which we used for our luggage. The bathroom was clean with a small but adequate shower, however we learned to shower in the evening because often there was inadequate hot water in the morning. The room furnishings included a safe and a TV. The staff was always very pleasant and helpful and all the receptionists spoke pretty good English. Although we booked our room with our airport transfer many months in advance of our stay, we were pleased to receive just a few days before our departure for Rome, an email from Liana Scappatura at the hotel, confirming our stay and our ride from the airport. Upon arrival at Rome Fiumicino airport, there was our driver holding a sign with our name on it. It is SO nice when things work out as planned. The included breakfast at the hotel consists of your choice of various pastries, cereals, coffee, tea, yogurt, juice, bread, butter, jam and milk served in a pleasant dining room by two delightful young women. The hotel is perfectly located just 5 minutes by foot to the Colosseum and less than 30 minutes by foot to most of the other main attractions of Rome. There are several good restaurants nearby, of which we can heartily recommend the Due Colonne, just up the street from the hotel at Via Dei Serpenti, 91. There is an ATM just a few steps away at via Cavour and an internet point nearby. There are stores near the hotel where you can buy gelato, fresh fruit, sausages, cheeses and freshly made sandwiches. What more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: missa019
Reviews.Content: While backpacking through Europe with my two sisters we found a really good deal on a B&B called the Anfiteatro Flavio online on a hotel booking website. It was only 60 euros so we were really excited! And what a great little hotel it was! They were going through some renovations while we were there, so it's probably only better now! They did have an elevator but it was VERY tiny, so we chose to take the stairs most of the time. Each room is named after some important Roman historical figure so your keychain for the room will have their name on it, I unfortunately can't remember who our room was named after! Our room was a triple, kinda small but with great ammenities! We had A/C, a small fridge, Cable TV, a balcony, comfy beds and a very clean bathroom! We were VERY happy with our choice of staying at the Anfiteatro Flavio! The staff was also very friendly and our stay included a small but reasonable free breakfast. Not to mention, the hotel was located directly down the street from the Colosseum. We could see it right when we walked out of the hotel, just at the end of the hotels street! I would definitely stay at the Anfiteatro Flavio again and have recommended it to friends who visited Rome. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: kelUK
Reviews.Content: HOTEL We stayed her for a long weekend (from 21/09 - 24/09 2007). We requested the airport collection taxi which was excellent,,, a very smartly dressed man was waiting at the airport with our name on a board,, he escorted us (carried our bags etc) to a lovley black Mercedes and drove us to our hotel. I would call this a chauffeur service rather than a taxi as it was very nice (classy). Once at the hotel we were quickly booked in and the receptionist took time to show us a map of Rome, she circled areas of intrest (landmarks such as Trevi fountain) and told us the best way to get to them,,, she told us the best places to eat and best areas to hang out in. We went to our room which was nice, clean and quite (as we had requested) we were in a room called Nerone. The bathroom was small but had everything you need. Saftey deposit box was included as was air conditioning. Bed was comfy. Beds were made up daily and towles changed every 2 days. One thing to remember is to lock your room, the doors do not lock themselves but is simple with the room key, we assumed they were self locking but luckily checked. Hotel was good value for money and better than exoected. The area where the hotel is situated is very close some lovley bars and restaurants, (out the hotel door to the left (2 min walk) in a nice courtyard, walk past the fountain and the next street has some more bars, we found a nice Irish bar with the football on which my husband was very impressed with. ROME Use the red bus tours,, great for seeing the whole city. Get up early as most tourists dont,we were in some places by 9am and had no waits etc, visit the Vatiguan on a Friday if possible - less busy or go late in the day to avoid long waits. Or pay for a guided tour as the price includes entry avoiding the long long waits (about 4+ hours) - it costs more but will save you time. (use Romaround tours [--]) Watch your bags at all time (especially when you are at the tourist sights) - my bag was opened whilst posing with gladiators, they offer to pose with you but will rob you!! Luckily for me my bag only contained water and guide book. Water is free and clean in Rome,,,, buy a water bottle,, once empty keep it as water is available at all fountains around the city it is fresh spring water,, we simply filled up regually. Take a guided tour of the coleseum, this gives you free pass to the Paletine and a tour which is very good & informative. We used romearound tours. Take a camera as there are so many things to see and do,,,, I shall add photos once I have sorted through them. WE LOVED ROME AND SHALL RETURN. Any questions please email,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room, no privacy and too much noice”
Reviews.Author: nmavro73
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived we were shown to the "Tacito" room on the ground floor. There was a small window overlooking a little balcony, where the external AC unit was, the water boiler and the closets the maids used. There was also a little table and chairs outside.Needless to say it was impossible to have that shutter open since people came to sit on that balcony from time to time. The closet with the maid's clothes was just outside our door. Every morning at 7.15am they were changing there, babbling loudly. They were going out on the balcony to wear their work shoes. And at around 3.00 pm when we were coming back for a nap they had all the dirty linen just outside our window, on that same balcony. Of course, they were babbling until they finished work so we couldn't get a decent nap either. One time, i heard a hotel employee talking loudly at 5.30 am. I was lucky to have ear plugs. The location was nice since we could move around Rome in minutes. The room was clean but very small, which i wouldnt really mind if all the above was not happening. The bed was not double but 11/2 and we could barely fit in.We asked to be moved when we first arrived but the hotel was fully booked at that moment and it is too much trouble to move after you unpack. I would not recommend this hotel and i would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Roman Holiday”
Reviews.Author: PeterGunnOne
Reviews.Content: Our visit at the Anfiteatro was very pleasant. The rooms are spotlessly clean, modern and very nice for those on a budget. The hotel staff was helpful and courteous, fluent in English, and friendly. The Continental breakfast was filling and tasteful. The location was very convenient, including the Italian ice cream shop across the street! This hotel is just right for the Euro conscious traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Good location on a very good budget”
Reviews.Author: jhendg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we havent got any complaint on this hotel. The staff speaks very good english, they are very helpful and corteous. We booked only a double bed but we were surprised as we also had an extra single bed. the space is not too bad and we even have a balcony(We had the commodo at 3rd floor). The air conditioned was a plus since it was very hot outside... The rooms were very clean and there's no smell at the toilet. The breakfast included were good. Were now croissant lovers after trying their different croissants.The location is a about 5-10min walk to colloseum and the forum and is about 5 min walk to nazionale where you can catch up the bus and see the city of ROme day or night. Restaurants are just around the corner. We wont forget the Gelateria infront of the hotel and it was very yummy.If you love rice on your meals , drop by the japanese resto infront of the hotel, The food was really nice though be aware that it's a little bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Flavour of the Flavio”
Reviews.Author: ElinLeeds
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for a few days at the beginning of June. It was better than we had expected after having read some of the reviews. It is in a scruffy little street, with an amazing view of the Colosseum from the front entrance. We stayed in a reasonable sized, comfortable and clean room at the top of the building. We could probably have had more luxurious accommodation, for not much more money on the outskirts of Rome, but I felt that you could not beat that location and we had everything that we needed, including excellent, free air conditioning. It felt like we were in the "real Rome". We were also close to the forum and some hard walking took us to other main attractions. If and when we return we will definitely make more use of public transport, (we came home sore and exhausted) however, we would have missed seeing some very interesting but unpublicised sights. There are many fascinating buildings and even a cat sanctuary in the enclosure where Julius Ceasar met his end. All in all we had a wonderful few days that ended far too soon.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy”
Reviews.Author: Susietaylor
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed 4 nights in June and were perfectly happy - perhaps we were lucky - we had booked a twin room and were given the "Messalina" on the 5th Floor which actually held 4 beds. We had read all the reviews before we booked and agreed to risk a smelly bathroom in return for a view of the Colliseum - it was well worth it. Our bathroom was modern, perfectly clean and fresh (not a trace of odour) and the shower was powerful and hot. Yes the room was small and basic but it was clean and the air conditioning was free and effective and we had a tiny (precarious looking) balcony to open our shutters out onto. The room was at the back of the hotel and quiet except for one morning (a couple of giggly girls coming in at 3.00am but who shut up immediately in response to to a bang on the wall!). True the hotel entrance and the staircase and landings are a bit shabby and seedy looking but the hotel is situated in a real Roman street, complete with scooters and graffiti but with super little shops (posh perfume shop right next door) and a helpful Pharmacist 2 doors up who patched up friend's blistered feet after a day's hard walking round historic Rome. Plenty of little food stores, reasonably priced and used by the locals. Warning - don't eat at the Wanted restaurant in the square with the fountain - not very nice.... Breakfast was fine - lovely friendly ladies in the breakfast room - but make sure you have a bit of everything - we didn't realise there was cereal or cream cheese for the rolls until day 2. If you can't face the lovely sweet pastries first thing in the morning, take yours out with you and eat it later - we ate ours for mid morning snack in the forum - great!! Agree about the miniscule lift but we thought it added to the charm and the experience. Great as a conveniently located base to see Rome from, the Colliseum at the top of the street and less than 10 minutes walk to the forum - certainly not posh and on our last day there was a young couple complaining about the foul smell in their loo - but overall we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: italyvacation
Reviews.Content: This B&B was great. Near the subway station. In a nice quiet part of town. 10mins from the Coluseum. Great location. Awesome Geletto place right across the street. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “View of the Colosseum”
Reviews.Author: wagr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for three nights in May 2007. It is located within a five minute walk from the Colosseum and you can actually see it at the end of the street in front of the hotel. We stayed in a triple room that was quite small. There was a foul odor emanating from the bathroom. Although we complained to the front desk, they did not do anything about it (perhaps they couldn't and it was just old plumbing). This necessitated keeping the bathroom door closed at all times. There was an air conditioner but the fan blew directly on one of the beds that was located in the smaller portion of the L shaped room so it was difficult to keep the room cool. The room was basically clean although far from spotless. The hallways and entrance to the hotel were not clean. The included breakfast was good - bread, pastries, cereal, yogurt, etc. Overall the staff were helpful and friendly. Directly across the street is a great gelato place - among the best we had anywhere in Italy (and it felt as if we tried them all!). About a block down the street (towards the Colosseum) was a small piazza with a fountain that was a local hangout. We enjoyed relaxing there and watching the children play. The location of the hotel was good and permitted us to walk most places. It was close to the subway which we used quite a bit too. I would probably not return to this hotel due to the bathroom odors and lack of overall cleanliness, although I have stayed in much worse hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A cute little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jenni_m84
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and i stayed here on the 25th Feb for 3 nights. I thought the location was amazing, you step out of the hotel and you can see the colosseum straight away! how good. The colosseum was the first attraction we went to, which is brilliant apart from beware... they have men dressed as gladiators outside which take your camera off you and take a picture and try and charge you for it!!! This was not the best expreience considering we had been in Rome less than an hour. The hotel is very small but i thought it was just right. I think 3 or 4 days is the right amount to stay here as there is no hotel entertainment or bar. Its perfect for staying while you are sightseeing, and as Rome is a large place after a whole day of walking its a perfect place to relax. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. There was a large choice of breakfast too. I found the restraurants around the tourist attractions to be overpriced and bland. If you walk a few blocks from any attraction it gets cheaper. There is the best ice cream shop in the world just opposite the hotel with hundreds of different flavours, i definatily recommend you to try one! I would recommend this hotel to young couples as it is cheap, right in the centre of rome and a respectful little hotel. The funniest thing was how small the lift was you could only just squeeze in two people, this was quite amuzing after a few drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great little find!”
Reviews.Author: miscellanity
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in late march for 2 nights. There were 3 of us travelling together and we booked a triple suite, however when we arrived we were awarded with a family suite big enough for 5 people! It was wonderful having such a large room. The room was fitted out with airconditioning and heaters, fridge, tv, safe and the bathroom had hot running water and was very clean. This hotel is in a fantastic location and you can literally see the colloseum right up the main street - it is within a easy walking distance and was a wonderful starting point to explore all of historic rome. Travelling to the vatican was also very easy - you just catch the 64 bus from a stop which is a very short distance away - the receptionists will be able to assist. The metro stop Cavour is about a 5 minute walk away - however you will not need to take it as everything is within walking distance - the only time we travelled by train is to get to/from termini station to get back to the airport by shuttlebus. I booked through expedia with no breakfast included, however the staff insisted we take the hotel breakfast with no extra charge which was greatly appreciated. Breakfast consisted of an assortment of croissants with fillings, coffee and yoghurt. The staff are happy to hold onto your bags after check out, however I would recommend having some locks readily available as they are left in the lobby (however under close watch). There are a great selection of restaurants nearby - we tried a restaurant called "WANTED" which was near the main intersection, and the food was to die for. Try any of their pizzas, and their gnocchi was fantastic (authentic stuff too - 3 mega sized dumplings, not the small western variety). The gelati store "Il Gelatone" directly opposite the hotel is also a gem and has a huge selection of gelati and is open until really late at night - should you get any icecream cravings towards midnight, you know where to go! Make sure you try their blood orange flavored gelati. Staff here are willing to help - in particular, night receptionist Lorenzo was fantastic (an extremely friendly and funny guy) and can give you a rundown of the cheapest way to see all of historic rome. In all - a fantastic experience and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: msdelilah
Reviews.Content: After many hours of searching the internet, I asked my travel agent to book here because of the wonderful reviews. I was VERY disappointed.
