My 17 year old daughter and I stayed at this B&B during Holy week 2007. We were booked in a triple room because my 16 year old son was also supposed to travel however his passport never came so he stayed home for this trip. Before leaving the USA, I requested a double room but the B&B staff said that they could not change the reservation. We arrived on a Friday night after our private car (50E) picked us up at the airport. The B&B arranged the car service and it was clean and efficient. The driver spoke very little English but he was polite and waiting as promised even though the flight was a little late. When we checked in to our room, we were given the Nerva room on the 3rd floor in the front of the building. The odor in the bathroom was overwhelming!! The smell of sewer was so strong that we had to immediately open the window and attempt to get some fresh air. The remote for the TV did not work and there were blown light bulbs. Other than that, the room was clean. Friday night I asked the desk staff to fix the TV and the lights. She said she did not have maintenance staff on the weekends but would see if house cleaning staff could do anything in the morning. Saturday morning the smell from the bathroom made me sick. I asked to move rooms and they said the manager was the only one who could move rooms and there was no manager on the weekend. They left me air freshener spray. Saturday night the street was LOUD and I was unable to get to sleep until about 3:00 am. Sunday morning I asked to be moved again and was again told I could only be moved by a manager and to check on Monday. I again told them how bad the smell was from the bathroom and they said there was nothing they could do. Sunday night my neighbors returned about 1am and proceeded to have loud relations. I asked the front desk staff to move me again. They said they could not. Monday I did not speak to the Manager as I had a tour to attend at St. Peters and did not have time. Tuesday morning when I finally spoke to a manager, she insisted that I had not complained at the right time of day to be moved and that if I had complained at the right time, I could have been moved. She gave me two keys to check on two empty rooms. I picked Constantino on the fourth floor. It was a TRUE improvement over Nerva. We changed rooms. The smell was gone. The room was quiet and we had a wonderful bathtub. I wish the staff had been more responsive when I complained multiple times. They seemed to have no idea how to handle any of my complaints. The manager did give me a discount on my room from 170E (which I booked at 165E) to 160E per night. Overall I would never recommend this B&B to anyone. I wish I had booked the Mercur as my travel agent recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Suberb small hotel”
Reviews.Author: nadinekettering
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this lovely little hotel in March for three nights, we were greeted by friendly reception staff who were both polite and helpful. Our room was modern clean and well equiped. Hotel situated within walking distance of most major sights, and the metro is only a couple of minutes walk away. Great wine bar almost opposite. Only negative thing to say is that hotel is well hidden, you can easily walk past it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice B&B, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BIGDUB71
Reviews.Content: I'll keep this short - it's a nice standard hotel. The rooms are fine and the shower/bathroom is up to standard. There is a bit of a pong in the bathroom but you're not there during the day to worry about it. All in all - the hotel is fine and adequate for all your needs in Rome. The location is excellent - Colisseum at the end of the road and if you go the other direction and turn right at the top of the street and then left down the tunnel - you'll be at the Trevi Fountain in about 10 minutes! Restaurant tip - Try the Subura restaurant beside the Cavour station - 5 minute walk and excellent food. Enjoy Rome - we certainly did.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel - why didnt i listen to the poor reviews?!”
Reviews.Author: Kellylp
Reviews.Content: I wish I had taken note of the poor reviews of this hotel as they were all true - this is definitely not worth 4 or 5 stars as some people are suggesting! (Having recently experienced some fabulous hotels in Australia that were 4 star on this website, this hotel is by no way comparable ) This hotel deserves nothing more than one star which i give for location and good cleanliness. We stayed in room Severo on the fourth floor (maybe those with good reviews had better quality rooms?!). It was incredibly basic and poorly decorated (yellowy smoke stained walls). Shower doors were falling off, bathroom lights kept failing, remote control on tv didnt work (not great when tv is positioned very high up in the corner of the room) and the noise in this hotel is unbearable. You can hear absoultely everything going on in the adjacent rooms, including all the ups and downs of marital life if you catch my drift. Everytime someone flushes a toilet, the noise is unbearable and wakes you up if you are asleep - there seems to be a common flushing system between the rooms. The noise outside is also very loud, especially on Friday and Saturday nights when the local kids hang out outside until the early hours of the morning. The double bed is 2 singles pushed together, so not the best and it was cold in March, with only a thin blanket to keep you warm at night. There are no provisions for a fire escape route (although this could be an Italy thing), and the staircase was dangerous - uneven stairs and unfinished handrails (I managed to get a huge splinter in my finger from them). If you are looking for a very basic hotel, then this is for you, but it certainly is not value for money for a basic hotel - 100 Euros/night. In summary a very poor quality hotel for the money, and would not recommend to anyone going to Rome in the near future. probably worth paying a tiny bit more to get somewhere decent .

Reviews.Title: “Great for parents and 2 teenagers”
Reviews.Author: bjgeraci
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel based on the reviews here. Thanks everyone! Room: We had the Augusto room on the Floor 1 (2nd floor for US people). It had 1 large bed for us parents and 3 single beds for our 2 teenagers. Each bed had its own switch for the lamp by the bed, and a 2nd switch for the ceiling light. The TV cable connection was fuzzy sometimes, but we weren't watching that much anyway. The room included a small fridge in the "desk" that the TV was on. The windows face out to the street (Via dei Serpenti), but are double-paned, so when they are closed it is quiet. The windows also have external shutters, so during our stay (February), it was nice to leave the windows open and the shutters closed to get both privacy and fresh cool air (temperatures ranged from 40-60 F). The bathroom shower stall was bigger than the other hotel we stayed in on this trip. Food: The included continental breakfast was pastry, a roll, choice of hot beverage (cappucino, hot choc, tea), nutella, fruit drink, yogurt. We found it enough to start the day. Area: The Cavour Metro station is just a 5 minute walk, and the #117 bus line stops in front of the hotel. There are oodles of places to eat nearby, and some specialty shops. If you want to get soft drinks for the room, a pharamacia and other small grocery stores are just up/down the street. Gelateria: the one across the street is just divine!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful Staff.”
Reviews.Author: AJCairns
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Anfiteatro Flavio in October 2006 for 2 nights. My brother and I travelled to Rome from London for a mini stay and to re-visit some Roman landmarks. We found this hotel to be more than adequate. We had a room right next to the breakfast room and even that wasn't too bad as far as early morning noise goes. The bathroom, whilst small was clean and very functional. The staff were helpful, and even gave us the name of a local trattoria that gave discounts to the guests of Anfiteatro Flavio. We arrived at about 11.30pm after a delay in London and there were staff waiting to greet us. They will also arrange a car to pick up and drop off guests at the airports. This place is so close to the Colosseum, that it can be seen straight down the road from outside the front door. The location is wonderful. I would assume that most people staying here are NOT here for the hotel anyway and that the delights of this city will be more than enough to keep you happy. This is a well located, budget hotel and I reccommend it. My mother ended up staying here about 6 weeks after me and she had no complaints either.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE..Dishonest manager”
Reviews.Author: melbournetraveller24
Reviews.Content: I booked with this hotel through an international accommodation provider [-] and after receiving a confirmed booking for 5 nights, paid the required deposit of USD 47.50. I was delighted, as the hotel was in a great location and sounded to be just what we required. However within 24 hours of making the booking the hotel emailed me and would not accept the booking, and requested that we pay twice the price for the 5 nights! I was shocked, as we had a confirmed reservation. This now meant that the hotel was out of my price range, so I immediately cancelled our booking...but the hotel still went ahead and charged our visa card for the deposit! It has taken me a full month of sending emails, most of which were never responded to, to eventually get reimbursed for HALF of the deposit money!!! Needless to say, I am one very unhappy customer! I think the hotel has been very dishonest.

Reviews.Title: “Good place.”
Reviews.Author: UkSb
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Between the collosseum and the fountain of Trevi. Friendly, able staff. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ktwilsano
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at this hotel. Fantastic location, as it was so close to all the sights it meant we could walk everywhere and managed to cover all the main attractions in a couple of days. The staff we lovely and helpful and gave us great recommendations for areas to visit and restaurants to go to off the tourist track. The hotel was very clean and great value for somewhere in the centre of town. I looked around the internet at about 30 different hotels in the centre, compared price and their reviews on Tripadvisor and came up with the Antiflavio, and wasn't disappointed. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget b&b”
Reviews.Author: gazbjo
Reviews.Content: This is a great little bed and breakfast in a fantastic location. The triple room we had was Remo (all the rooms are named after Roman Emporers) and it was small but clean. The 'double bed' was 2 twins put together and quite hard but ok and the central heating wasn't too good at night. The only other not so good thing about the room was that the tv only had local channels in Italian. I like to watch tv to relax before I go to sleep and wasn't able to, but hey, what do you expect for a budget room? The staff were all fantastic! From Ivor/Ivan?, the night receptionist who checked us in and gave us the low down on where to go and what to see, to the girls who were on breakfast duty. They didn't speak english too well but tried very hard and worked even harder. The location of the hotel is amazing for the price. If you take 2 or 3 steps onto the road outside and look down the via del Serpenti, you'll see the side of the Colloseum (about a 5 mins walk) with the Roman forum right next to it. Indeed the hotel is within walking distance to pretty much everything there is to see, the Vatican city and museums apart. So if your looking for a great location and not going to spend too much time in the hotel, this is ideal. One thing you really need to know though, dont make eye contact with street vendors or they'll keep trying to sell you their wares and watch out for gypsy kids. I was approached by to young girls and a boy going down stairs at the colloseum. 2 on one side and one on the other and when we approached they switched places. The young boy tried to put a bit of card with writing on it under my face and I felt the young girl try and dip my pockets. I slapped her hand out the way and shouted at them but with lots of gypsies in the area, I didn't want to do too much else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but Not Good Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: ahsot
Reviews.Content: The Anfiteatro Flavio is not a hotel to stay in for more than 2-3 days; unfortunately we were booked for 7 days from 12/8-12/14. The pictures shown on the website are extremely misleading; the bathroom was extremely small. The smell permeating from the toilet was unpleasant as well. Luckily, I came prepared with an air freshener and flushing the totel sounded worse than flushing airplane toilets. Going to the toilet at night always woke up whoever was sleeping. We also had an issue where there was some type of water pump on our balcony that came on every night at 3:30 am, 4:30 am and 5:30 am so getting a restful sleep did not happen until I was headed back home on the airplane. The sheets were never changed after I specifically asked to have them changed; I knew because there was a hole in the sheet on our double bed which was two twin beds pushed together. They were not even twin longs because my boyfriend is 6'2" and we had to sleep on an angle so he could fit. The phone did not work until the night before we were to leave Rome. The best attributes at the hotel were the cappuccino and croissants (the ladies in the cafe were truly nice), the location (down the street from the colliseum/metro stop) and the two gentlemen that worked the front desk were always helpful. After much research I really thought I had chosen the right place to stay while in Rome but at 93 euros a night; I clearly made the wrong choice. I would not recommend the Anfiteatro Flavio to anyone unless they were just passing through for less than 3 days; actually it is only worth staying overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Verty pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: ilming
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the apartments of the hotel that was decorated to a high standard, with efficient central heating and also air conditioning - that we did not need in December. The shower room also had basin, bidet and WC and seemed to heve been recently fitted out to high standard. There are 2 bedrooms and another room fitted out with a kitchenette. The only drawback was that the appartment we occupied was 2 floors up with a somewhat uneven concrete staircase and no lift. The staff were very helpful and assisted us as much as necessary.

Reviews.Title: “A good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Gilstef
Reviews.Content: The Anfiteatro Flavio is a very good place to stay in Rome. It's very convenient to walk to the main spots of interest. The rooms are simple but confortable and the appartment Mario is very pleasant for a family or group of friends. Breakfast is good and the receptionists are very helpful and speak indifferently Italian, French or English. We were a group of 8 and we had a wonderful time in Rome. Many thanks again !

Reviews.Title: “fab position”
Reviews.Author: Neesa
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in anfiteatro flavio. We booked with lastminute and prebooked a taxi with the hotel via email (see their own website) from Learnado De Vinci Airport for E50. This went so smoothly, and the driver even stopped the car to let us take photos on our way in, that we also booked our taxi for the way back. Taxi journey from LDV airport to hotel was about 35mins. Arrived at the hotel and was delighted to see so many resteraunts within 2min walk of the hotel as well as a fantstic view of the coloseum from the road! Check in at the hotel was a breeze, we were promptly given our room key. Note: most hotels do take your passport upon check in, but there is a room safe, and if like me and my friend, you are under 26 and you show your passport (or driving license), then you get discounted entrance to many of the sites including the colosseum (E6.50 instead of E11) and the Vatican museum (E11.50) along with many others. For 2 people, we had the Nerva room on the 3rd floor with a double bed and a single bed (v.clean!). There was one lift, however it was small and meant for 2 people, with 2 small luggages (so ok for us). Not really a problem if youre on the lower floors though (went upto level 5). Room size was good, there was room to fit our luggage on the side and walk around the beds. We had a dressing table and chair, and 2 sets of cupborads with hangers for clothes. There was also a safe (the key is attached to the room key so impossible to lose!) and a fridge in the room. Our room overlooked the main Via Di Serpenti Rd, which wasnt too noisy with the windows open, and dead silent with the windows closed. The bathroom was a good size, super clean! There was the usual sink, shower, toilet and little bidet. Only problem we had was the water draining a little slow in the shower, but other than that, no probs. Oo, they do provide towels, but they are not what i am customed to- i.e. they were more thin tea-towel thickness than normal home-towel thick, so i would suggest you take one along if you are like me. There was complimentary shower gel and shampoo/conditioner and soap (no toothpaste so bring your own). Also out of the 3 nights we were there, cleaner came twice and restocked. Shopping: we went mainly for the 2 main roads: via del corso and via di nazionale, both within walking distance (i.e. 1-10min walk). Dont be put off by pricier tags on shop displays, some of the shops have real cheap gems if you are willing to give it a try! They have the usual name branded shops, e.g. as well as Armani, prada, gucci, CK, Nike, Adidas, they had Zara and united colours of benetton as well as several italian shops. For souveneir shops, there arnt really shops per se. In fact, we found the small stands around major sites best for souveniers. The cheapest area for souveniers was the piazza between St Peters (stunning, and free entry) and the Vatican museums (moderate charge) with magnets costing approx. 3euros and statues starting from 2euros. Sights: this is where rome hurts you. On the feet! There are many sights we saw, all within walking distance of each other. The exception was the vatican city for which we took the metro (1euro for a single journey- tickets are bought in the station from a machine which is in italian or english- so keep change on you!). The main sights to see are: Colosseum (entry fee), Roman Forum (free), Palatino (included in coloseum price, but to be honest, not worth it if you are without a tour guide here as its so easy to get lost!), Vatican city, pantheon, Trevi fountain, Spanish steps and Castel Sant Angelo (5euro entry) to name a few. There is piazza navona, which we thought we could get away with visiting in the daytime, but to be honest, it doesnt come alive until the evening. Warnings: do try to keep your wits about you especially when it comes to poor people with babies who sometimes try to steal from you. We did not have a problem, but it appeared that they went after oriental people more, e.g. by pick pocketing. I am not trying to scare you, because we did not really see this, but we did hear about it so just passing it on: Take care of your essentials especially at main attractions, and you will be ok! Food: Overall, as vegetarians, we had no problem with food whatsoever. The free breakfast in the hotel was served in the basement from 7.30am to 9.30am. Food offered included yoghurt, danishes and pastries, cereals, dried toast, rolls and tea/coffee or red orange juice. Italy are not big on their Teas so if you cant stand the thought of no tea or bad tea, take your own tea bags!!! The coffee on the ohter hand, is divine no matter where you go!! For dinner, we tried Mother India (left of the hotel) which was superb! 2 courses and glass of wine/water was approx 9euros each. We also tried an italian resteraunt on the right side of the hotel where the pizza was lovely. I had margherita, mixed salad and a coke for only 8euros! We also ate at an italian on the top of via nazionale which had yummy pasta! Note: if you ask for red peppers, they add chillies! They dont really tend to have red or green peppers as we do in london or if they do, they dont call it peppers! Coz to them peppers=chilli=hot hot hot! Note: DO try teh gelataria across the hotel. The icecream is not to be missed! I had a cookies n vanilla icecream, smallest pot (equivalent of 2 scoops) for 1.50euros which was the right portion (my standards!) and pure heaven. My firend had a mint choc icecream and it was sooo fresh and lovely too. They actually used real mint leaves and not additives!! Spending: We went fro 3 nights, and took about 200euros spending per person for general eating/drinking, taxi one way and light shopping. It was enough, but if you run short, there are ATMS all over the city, and not too far from the hotel - not that we were ever in there long enough other than to sleep!! Overall: Fab position of hotel on quiet road ... helpful reception with free advice and maps... decent brekkie... Fab icecream and coffee and pasta and pizza...Just take your towel along and youll love it! Hope that helps! Enjoy your holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great location small room for 4”
Reviews.Author: vanheeswijk
Reviews.Content: Ihave just come back frome spending 3 days in Rome at this hotel. I was there with my daughter (14),niece(12) and my mum we all shared a quad room although it was more like a double with 2 extra bed in, not much room, certainly not the room in the in the pictures on the web site. It was very clean and a nice bathroom. The staff were very pleasent and helpfull.Breakfast was adequart. The location was superb not too noisey off the main roads. Again the picture on most web site of the front of the hotel is not actually the hotel. Check out the ice cream parlour across the road it has about 70 flavours. Overall it was good value for money and the rooms may not seem so small if there are only 2 of you ,and we did not spend much time in the room apart from sleeping as we did plenty of sightseeing. D van Heeswijk ,Belper Derbyshire

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel minus the plumbing odor”
Reviews.Author: 1kat
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Flavio for 4 days. We were pleasantly surprised by the large quad room and cleanliness but the daily odor from the plumbing was not so pleasant. On a daily basis we would ask for them to check the plumbing, to put air freshner in the bathroom so that the nite wouldn't be so bad. Daily, the receptionist would nod his/her head, speak in English, and still nothing was done other than the maid leaving the windows wide open while we were gone during the day. I know this is not a new problem to them since I've read this complaint a few times at least on this site but obviously nothing has been done. Also the walls and doors are thin so during the nite you will hear the front door, the elevator, and whoever is in the hallway very clearly as if you had the door wide open. We stayed on the second floor facing the street. The location is great, the hotel is clean, the quad was a great size, the gelato shop across the street is great, and the price is decent. The breakfast is average, small assortment of pastry and yogurt, and I really enjoyed my daily cappucino. There are convenient restaurants to the left and right of the hotel ranging from pizzaria to indian. You always have to check for up front service charges in Rome and decide if you want to eat there. But I didn't have any bad food in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: vtf
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located in a wonderful area, not only close to major attractions but also close to restaurants. Often when you read reviews and hear that a major attraction is closeby when you arrive its not quite what you were led to belive. This is the exception the colesum is only a few blocks away and can be seen as soon as you exit the hotel. The rooms were nice, with a small balcony. The breakfast was adequate. The staff were very helpful . The only complaint that I had was that when we checked in the room was not ready (which we knew as we were arriving early) so we left our bags in the foyer for several hours. When we returned we were surprised to see the bags still in the foyer left unattended. In North America the bags would have been taken upstairs when the rooms became vacant. My only other comment relates to the open bus tour. The receptionist gave us incorrect information and sold us two tickets. It was a disaster (take the red bus it runs every 5 minutes, the open bus runs every hour despite the information provided at the hotel). WHen we returned we complained and was advised that they would contact the bus company and get back to us. We heard nothing else. Overall this was a wonderful hotel that I would strongly recommend. (go down to the restaurant in the piazza down teh street and check out the dog).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MCorrigan
Reviews.Content: First time in Rome, pleasantly surprised. Great location, a few minutes from the colosseum. Bus outside the door right into centre. Staff very friendly and helpful. Small rooms but clean. Would recommend to others. Corrigans, Omagh, N.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Place”
Reviews.Author: pixie_scar
Reviews.Content: I visited Rome last November with my boyfriend and as we were both pretty strapped for cash, we looked for the cheapest thing in the best place and crossed out fingers and hoped for the best! Surprisingly, The Flavio is a lovely little hotel a stones throw away from the Colloseum and central to almost everything. The room was compact, but clean. The shower was very powerful which was nice at the end of a long day walking. We were on the ground floor, which I could imagine would be a bit of a nightmare in high season as we could hear everything that was going on in the reception area. The receptionist were wonderfully helpful people with a fantastic english vocabulary which put me to shame! Somewhere I would definately return to!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Rome!”
Reviews.Author: whiskypie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful vacation in Italy. During our stay in Rome, we were fortunate enough to have had the pleasure of finding the Anfiteatro Flavio B & B. We had the most spacious room ( I think we could have fit the entire family!) with a full size bathroom and air conditioning!! Every morning they served a delightful continental breakfast. The staff was also most helpful and pleasant. They were able to answer any questions we had or give directions to any place we wanted to go. I think all of the staff spoke English, which is very helpful!! I would (and have!) recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Rome. It is very close to all the tourist attractions. We walked everywhere: Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona. We took a short bus ride to the Vatican(although I think we could have walked that, as well, if we tried). It was walking distance from the Train Station, as well..less than a mile :) I'm looking forward to my next visit to Rome, next year. We will be staying at the Anfiteatro Flavio again! Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Ciao Flavio!”
Reviews.Author: OzDuff
Reviews.Content: The Anfiteatro Flavio is a small hotel in the centre of Rome only 500m from the Colosseum. It is a great place to start your tour of beautiful Roma and seeing the colosseum every morning was a real buzz. Transport is close with the metro at the Colosseum and buses that go directly past. Everything is at your fingertips, resturants bars and icecream parlours with great views. The hotel rooms are nothing special so i can see why some people expect more for their money. You are not paying for the room, it is all about location, location, location! The hotel does not have an exterior sign and it doesn't need one, as it was booked out for the entire summer. Breakfast was sweet, you are served fresh coffee, cereals, pastries, breads and juices. Rooms on the ground floor are nice as you do not have to take the elevator. (which only fits one person) There is also a great internet cafe 200m from the hotel. Overall a small secretly hidden hotel in the heart of historical Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Haven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel. Brilliant location - (Colosseum just at the end of the street!!!), great bars restaurants. Plus walking distance (hey, when in Rome!) to all the sights (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, shopping district, ancient Rome). The room had a super power shower, well decorated and the floor tiles and curtains were a welcome relief from the scorching heat. Hotel staff so helpful and friendly. Thank you for making my Roman Holiday a treat. I can't understand the negative reviews - this place is a find!

Reviews.Title: “Hated this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nothing like the photos that are posted! The rooms are absolutely terrible! Its expensive considering what ur getting too, its €145 a night and you can stay in a lovely 4 star for €210. We tried to check out immediately but they refused to give us our money back ie they would charge us no matter what! This hotel is a disgrace whatever you do don't stay here, stay somewhere decent, if you walk up the road there's a decent hotel called hotel hiberia for the same price which is much better!. Do not stay at this hotel if ur booked in cancel it!!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, great location, paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: miso2006
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful, multilingual staff gave us tons of useful information. Breakfast (and breakfast staff) very nice. As said in some of the earlier reviews, the hotel can be loud depending on who is staying in the room next to yours. Our room was very loud the first three nights and quiet the last night after a different guest(s) moved in next door to us. We would consider staying there again, but might not out of concern for noise. Basically, if you're a heavy sleeper, I would absolutely reccomend this hotel. If you are a light sleeper, it's all about luck.

Reviews.Title: “I would visit the "Anfiteatro Flavio" again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a rather spontaneous trip to rome. I booked the flight and the hotel just a week before. Actually, I was intending to spend about 100 Euro per night for the room, but the cheaper bed&breakfast location in the center were fully booked, already. So was happy to get a room at the "Anfiteatro Flavio". We got a room in the 4th floor. Luckyly, there is an elevator in the hotel. It's a very small one so you won't use it if you suffer from claustrophobia *g*, but it's really helpful to get you luggage up to your room. Our room was small, but sufficient and well equipped: With air condition (well, we don't used it), a safe (included, no extra fee), a tv (well, who will watch tv in rom? The channels are all in italian, anyway) and even a small refrigerator. The floor has no carpet, but floor tiles which I liked a lot (better hygiene). The room was also clean. Well, unless you have a look under the bed. The bed: we slept well. The bath was fine. The shower hat a solid cabin (not one of these awful curtains) and there was ever enough hot water. The bath also had a bidet. The bath would have been perfect if the sprinkler of the shower would not have been broken (unable to fix it at the wall) and if the cabin itself would'nt have been a little bit defect (it was however working perfectly). The "Anfiteatro Flavio" is in the center of room. And although the Via dei Serpenti is a small one-way street, it's a rather busy one with a lot of traffic. And italians love to use the signal horn. So, you either need be really tired to get asleep or just close the windows. The windows have double panes and really keep all the noise out. After lecture of my rom travel guide ("forget the breakfast in the hotels, get to a coffee shop"), I had no expectations regarding the breakfast. Well, ok, don't expect ham&sausages, scrambled or boiled eggs etc. pp. - Which one might expect looking at the price of the room. Such a breakfast seems to be quite unusual in Italy. You however get biscuits and jam or honey, good coffee or capucino, a yogurt, cornflags and fruit juice. So, the breakfast really was better than expected. Last, but not least I'd like to mention that the personal was very friendly and helpful. And the personal at the reception speaks english. I used a taxi to get from ciampino airport to the hotel and was tricked by the driver: The meter was off during the drive and he finally requested 68 Euro, about twice as much as expected. However, the hotel managed to get the taxi company to pay 25 euro back. Great service! On the other hand: The hotel requests 50 Euro for arranging the transport to the airport... I really enjoyed my stay in Rom. The "Anfiteatro Flavio" is located in the center of Rome and we just walked to the common places. The price for the room was rather high. But I guess it's just common in Rome. Beside of the price, I was quite happy with the hotel and would visit it again, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Little & Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Indiana Jane
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great location, is pretty quiet (cosidering where it is) and has very friendly, helpful staff. The rooms are tiny but that is part of it's charm - enjoy it! N.B: If you need a cab to the airport, ask them at reception & they will book it for you at a set rate.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic time in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner went to Rome for two nights for a weekend break. The location of the hotel is excellent you can walk everywhere and the receptionist was very helpful providing maps and telling us about the buses we could get if we wanted to. The breakfast was good and the rooms clean. We had a small balcony which was nice. If we were to return to Rome we would certainly stay again. The ice cream place across the road is lovely and if you arrive late and want a bite to eat head to 'wanted' which is a few meters up the road if you walk in the direction of the colleseum. All in all i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “comfort of classics”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in the very center of delightful Rome. 5 minutes to Coliseum, 10 minutes to Piazza Venezia. It's always quietly in Anfiteatro Flavio, nobody keeps noisy. Comfortable rooms and careful staff. Thank you from Moscow!

Reviews.Title: “Paper-thin walls”
Reviews.Author: MavenNyc
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on other reviews. We only wish someone had noted that the walls at this hotel were paper thin! While the hotel was reasonably well insulated against the street noise -- a common complaint for Rome hotels -- the noise from other guests was another story. At night, when I was trying to sleep, I had the pleasure of listening to someone else's husband snore and someone else's husband use the toilet. We wound up switching hotels after 2 nights -- we would have switched after 1, but it was a weekend and we had trouble finding another room. The other hotel (Paba) which was only 1 block away was quieter, had a nicer room, was the same price, and perhaps, more importantly, was relatively sound-proof from the other guests. The only good thing I can say about the hotel is the location. Via del Serpenti is a great eating street. Good pizza, good gelato, a good falaffel/schwarma place and even good Indian food (when you get tired of all Italian all the time as we did after 2 weeks in Italy).

Reviews.Title: “Just About Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: NikNak79
Reviews.Content: Spent many hours on tripadvisor trying to find a decent hotel for our first visit to Rome and wasn't disappointed. Where shall I start .... E-mailed hotel in advance and they arranged a taxi to collec us at the airport for 55 euros as our flight didn't arrive till late. The first night we were taken to another hotel, just around the corner because apparently there was a something wrong with the bathroom in our room at the Afiteatro. No problems here, walked round to our hotel in the morning where they couln't have been more apologetic. Room of a nice size, with a tv, safe and a fridge inside which came in useful. Check out Italian TV late at night for dodgy Pop Idol style talent shows .... very amusing ! Colessium at the top of the street, about 10 mins away. Trevi Fountain area about 20 mins. We walked everywhere - even to the Vatican which took us a bit longer though, but still very manageable. All in all this hotel was a fab choice, good location, good room, helpful staff and brilliant geleteria just opposite!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on lastminute.com after checking out this website and reading some favourable reviews of this hotel. As this was my first time visiting Rome and in the guise of our wedding anniversary, I was very impressed with the Anfiteatro. We arrived before midday and were allowed straight into our rooms which whilst cosy were clean, well heated, air conditioned and had a very good power shower! Staff were very friendly and the location with the Coleseum at the end of the road truly magical. There were some great enotecha's and delis around, a great cafe across the road for some powerful coffee and some good restaurants nearby. All in all an excellent hotel to find and one where I hope to return in the near future as visiting Rome once is "never enough!"

Reviews.Title: “Im in love with the Anfiteatro Flavio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On my 1st trip to Rome stayed in this little hotel and it was perfect.Rooms were spotless and cosy.Ivan on Reception was wonderful he even opened the breakfeast room at 6am to facilitate our early departure.Great part of the city,Small individual shops outside your door.Cavour station 1 stop from Termani,Coloseem at doorstep.Can't beat the price,excellent value for money.Wouldn't stay anywhere else.will be back. Adrian & Louise Tullamore Co.Offaly.Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: julierice
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the great reviews that I read on here. We had a clean comfortable room on the top floor, I was disappointed that we hadnt got a room on the street side like I had asked but the hotel had to be fair said that they would try but couldnt promise. My only beef about the hotel was that the room was a little cold, and on our first day it rained all day so we came back to a cold room, and tea and coffee making facilities would have been more welcome than a fridge. I had emailed the hotel previously and asked them if they could arrange a taxi transfer for us as we were arriving late and we were met at the airport and taken to the hotel for 55 Euros. The hotel is in a great spot for visiting the historic sites. The Colliseum is at the bottom of the road and from there you can easily plan a route around the city . The Vatican is a must and dont miss the walk up the steps to the top of St Peters Basillica. Take your passport or driving license with you to the Vatican Museums if you want the audio tour as you must present ID to be able to hire the equipment. Also be aware that on some days the Vatican Museums close at lunchtime. Rome is very compact and its easy to walk everywhere. We went on The Red Open Top Bus on the last day just to make sure we hadnt missed anywhere. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within walking distance of the hotel. We had a nightcap every night in one of the bars in the square near the hotel. If you want lots of nightlife and shops stay near the Spanish Steps/Via Venuto, but if shopping's not your thing.. and it isnt ours then The Anfiteatro Flavio is an ideal choice. We decided to walk to the Piazza Venezia to get a taxi back to the airport and had a very pleasant half an hour sitting in the sun listening to an accordian player before we got a white taxi back to the airport for 28 Euros. We flew with RyanAir from East Midlands airport, flights on time both ways.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, central accomodation”
Reviews.Author: Baharini
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in central Rome. You can see the Colosseum from the door! We had a bit of a mix up on arrival as my friend and I had booked a twin room and were told there was only a double. We insisted that wouldn't do and were given a triple room which was quite spacious and very comfortable. Lovely fresh Croissants and cake for breakfast. Great ice cream from the gelato opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, rooms too noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After having read the reviews on this forum, we decided this was the place for us. We arrived to a very wet and rainy Rome and the room we were first allocated was at the reception area, it had a small 'window' which looked out onto a very small courtyard area (which contained loads of old junk) and there was also a door in the room that had a opening the full length of the building. Therefore the noise of the rain was unbearable! Also the noise from the reception itself was quite bad, we could hear people talking and the noise from the television. Needless to say we didn't get any sleep! Other that that the room was very small but warm and cosy. We asked to be moved but there were no available rooms until the next morning. We moved rooms absolutely no problem, the staff were excellent. This room was a pretty poor standard compared to the first one, the sink in the bathroom was leaking and there was a very bad damp smell in the room, the shower door was broken and the shower was in pretty bad condition. It also had 2 single beds pushed together, which is so uncomfortable. However not wanting to complain again we decided it would do. All was going well until new guests arrived in the room next to us, all I want to say of this matter is THE WALLS ARE PAPER THIN!! And we could hear everything that was going on! The best part of this place is the location. The staff are friendly and helpful enough. Another thing, we booked through lastminute and it says there is a bar area where you can enjoy coffee or drinks, there isn't!!

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly, ideally situated”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first visit to Rome, staying in this hotel. We went with some apprehension as some reviews we read were not wholly satisfactory. However, we were toally satisfied and felt that some of the reviews did not give a true picture. Yes, the rooms are perhaps on the small side, but they are clean and comfortable having recently been refurbished. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. They cannot do enough to please. The hotel arranged for a taxi to pick up at the airport (50 Euro) which proved a bonus as we arrived after midnight. The situation is perfect - all places of interest are within 10 - 30min walking distance. You may have some difficulty in locating the hotel as there is no sign for it. Number 130 though is clearly marked on the wall!! We have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this hotel to you, and we look forward to a further visit ourselves. David & Loraine Bussell 4 December 2005

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: bjtim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in October 2005. The room was clean and comfortable with a nice bath/shower, we had a twin room on the 4th floor facing the back, nice and quiet except for some noisy young guests staying next door for 2 nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the location is very good within walking distance of most tourist sites, around 20 minutes walk to St. Peter's and the Vatican, down the end of the street is the Colosseum and a short walk up the road are the Spanish Steps. Very good shops in the same street, restaurants, bars, pizza, greengrocers/general store and delicatessans close by - would recommend the gelato opposite the hotel, friendly service and many flavours to choose from. Would stay at this hotel again if we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staying in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It was nice to be in Rome. The Hotel accomodation was perfect. Nothing wrong with it. It was situated in the centre of the city, so we could go in several directionsThere was only a little problem on the airport, because the name of the hotel has changed. He did 'nt know, but with the telephone all problems were solved. We are very grateful about the help of the managers in the hotel. There advices were given with patient en of all clear. If possible we will sure return in the hotel next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. A bit difficult to find initially as there is no name displayed and we had only an address and then had to ask around. The hotel is very clean, staff are friendly and helplful and the location is great. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great (apart from our last night)”
Reviews.Author: itbo
Reviews.Content: After spending 45 minutes looking for the hotel (there are no signs and noone seems to have heard of it - *tip* it's opposite the ice cream parlour who also hadn't heard of it!!) we were greeted with a warm welcome. Our room was clean and well equipped and the hotel itself is well located. The orange juice at breakfast was the nicest I have ever tasted. All was going swimmingly and we had a great time in Rome until our last night..... We arrived back to the hotel after our meal at just after midnight (there is a supposed 24hour reception) and buzzed so the night porter could let us in. After several attempts there was no response. We looked through the door to see him asleep, and he was not to be woken. We tried everything to wake him, but we only managed to wake up the rest of Rome. At 1.50am, after nearly 2 hours of shouting, banging, calling and sitting outside on the verge, he finally woke up. This was not a good end to our holiday, especially having to get up early to catch a flight. And had we not paid the day before we left, we would have demanded a discount. Other than that, a pleasant stay!!

Reviews.Title: “A very distressing hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After an eveing flight the first thing we wanted to do was to get to the hotel and rest. At the hotel we were shown a room down stairs that can only be described as a broom cupboard. There was no window, it stunk and there was no door leading to the bathroom. Going back to reception and saying that we hadn't paid for that room we had spent a lot of money and were promised what we had seen on the internet the receptionist then told us basically that there was nothing they could do and we had no room. After discussing the matter for an hour and speaking with the manager they put us up in a local hotel only because we stood up for our rights-by this time it's 11'0clock at night-were walking through Rome and we had to carry our own luggage. The next morning we had to come back at 11'oclock to get the room we had orignally booked. It appears to us the hotel management have this system so if they have a paying customer in the hotel for that night they can take extra money and they don't care about the customers that are distressed as they have overbooked. The reception staff were extremely rude, basically unhelpful-they didn't make us feel welcome and tended to be smoking our on their mobiles for personal calls or. When we did get our room eventually, we were shown a space that contained 3 singles beds and not the double we had booked, the singles were then put to together with a gap down the middle to make a double which gave back ache and the remaining single became a sofa and took up alot of space. The make-shift wafrdrobe was far too small for 2 people. The room was very dusty and floor seemed as though it had never been cleaned. The Breakfast Area was located near the broom cupboard room and there was a general space being used as what can only be described as a general rubbish tip. Matresses and there bases were left there to be built. The marjority of the time you had to wait -10 minutes to be seated for breakfast as the area was too small for the amount of guests they were ripping off. The breakfast menu was never changed and after 8 days can be become slightly tedious. The icing on the cake was the constant drilling and hammering noises of hotels maintance work which seems absolutely ricidulous for the busiest time of the year. We both had a wonderful time in Rome and enjoyed our holiday despite this disressing and upsetting hotel environment. We would both reccommend you to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great little bed and breakfast in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: marcol
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be exactly as described on its web site. Good central location within walking distance of most tourist attractions.We had a small clean comfortable room and a bathroom that neatly fitted in.The breakfast lacked imagination but rolls, coffee, pastries and juice were laid out every day by two very friendly ladies and the breakfast area was pleasant and clean with cafe style tables. Reception staff were very helpful and approachable. If you're visiting Rome and looking for value for money, this is the place for you. TIPS: Take the 110 tourist open top bus to get your bearings then you will find that almost every attraction is within easy reach. Good value at 13.00 euros for an all day ticket. BEWARE: Pickpocket gangs, thieves and bag/purse snatchers operate continually on Metro and bus services, especially 64 bus from Termini to Vatican. These are professional criminals....don't be complacent. We found out the hard way!!!

Reviews.Title: “a total rip off”
Reviews.Author: heftug
Reviews.Content: do not trust the foto's they show you on the ineternet. We ended up with a room so small that we had to put our suitcases on a shelf above our bed, to get some livingspace.The room was certainly not redecorated since the 60-s. It was small, smelly, with a bad AC and a shower that kept dripping all day. The hallway leading to this room was filthy with an old carpet, and a closet with its doors hanging out. When I complained, the btw very friendly staff, they did not know what I meant, till I started speaking Italian, wich I can fairly. They promissed us a better room the next day, wich we got. It was better then the one we had, but certainly not the level shown on internet. The nayberhood is perfect, as the location is. But it has a very bad price/quality rate. I do not know how the pricelevel is for americans or other not Europeans, but for Dutch standards this was really not a cheap hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We will certainly not recommennd this hotel to friends or relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For first timers to Rome we found this hotel very well located. All of the main attractions in ancient Rome were within 20 minutes walk. The Vatican is further but the No 64 Bus is close by and will get you there in 20 minutes. The manager (who speaks 5 languages) and her team were most pleasant and helpful with our many enquiries. The rooms have recently been refurbished and as far as Italy goes were value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Anfiteatro Flavio
HotelInfo.Address: Via dei Serpenti 130, 00184 Rome, Italy
